name: seg2recon
description:
FreeSurfer is a software package for the analysis and visualization of neuroimaging data from cross-sectional and longitudinal studies. It is developed by the Laboratory for Computational Neuroimaging at the Martinos Center for Biomedical Imaging.

FreeSurfer provides full processing streams for structural and functional MRI and includes tools for linear and nonlinear registration, cortical and subcortical segmentation, cortical surface reconstruction, statistical analysis of group morphometry, diffusion MRI, PET analysis, and much more. It is also the structural MRI analysis software of choice for the Human Connectome Project.

inputs.name: Segmentation volume
inputs.description: Aseg-type volume, e.g., from synthseg, fastsurfer, psacnn, samseg, or aseg.

inputs.name: Input volume
inputs.description: Input volume as would be passed to recon-all.

inputs.name: Color table
inputs.description: Color table for the segmentation. Uses embedded table if available, or FreeSurferColorLUT.txt if not specified.

inputs.name: Dilate binarization
inputs.description: Dilate binarization of segmentation when creating brainmask. Default is 2.

inputs.name: Number of threads
inputs.description: Number of threads to use for processing.

inputs.name: Force update flag
inputs.description: Force regeneration of files whether needed or not.

inputs.name: Brainmask
inputs.description: Use this mask as brainmask instead of computing from segmentation.

inputs.name: Headmask
inputs.description: Use this headmask instead of running mri_seghead.

inputs.name: No bias field correction
inputs.description: Do not compute or apply bias field correction.

output-files.description: Output aseg.auto.mgz file including corpus callosum segmentation
output-files.name: Aseg auto MGZ

output-files.description: Bias field corrected output nu.mgz file
output-files.name: NU MGZ

author: FreeSurfer Developers
